data.title: Corum Group
data.text:
So-Net Entertainment to acquire Gamepot

So-Net Entertainment Corp. (Japan) launched a tender offer to acquire Gamepot Inc. (Japan), a developer of online game software. Gamepot Inc, located in Tokyo, Japan, develops online game software that includes mobile contents and solutions. The operations are carried through the following divisions: Online Games and Mobile Contents. Online Games division includes online game distribution services and corporate game services. It is also engaged in the planning, distribution and management of online game software.

Announcement Date: February 28, 2008

Deal Value: $73.4 million (Cash)

Signature Devices to acquire Ascended Entertainment

Signature Devices Inc. is acquiring Ascended Entertainment LLC, a PC game development company. The acquisition of Ascended Entertainment will give Signature Devices control of its current website as well as the rights to Pandora Studios. The agreement will also include Ascended Entertainment's Artificial Studios Reality engine and control over the development of the company's video game, Red Cell. Signature Devices creates, develops and manufactures advanced information technology, including computer systems, software and electronics products. One of the company's technologies includes a blend of hardware and software for image generation technology used in video games and simulations.

Announcement Date: February 27, 2008

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Electronic Arts makes offer for Take-Two

Current offer was rejected Video game maker Electronic Arts Inc. urged the publisher of "Grand Theft Auto" to quickly accept its unsolicited $2 billion takeover bid, saying it's only a matter of time before it declares "game over" and pulls its premium offer. Grand Theft Auto has sold 65 million copies in various incarnations and is considered one of the most successful video games in history. In its offer, EA is banking on the success of GTA IV, and hopes to put its marketing muscle behind the eagerly awaited title. Take-Two would give EA a shot at keeping its post as the world's top video game publisher. French media and telecom giant Vivendi SA plans to combine EA's chief rival, Activision Inc., with its own games unit to form Activision Blizzard. The combined company will own the wildly popular online game "World of Warcraft" and the "Guitar Hero" franchise. A Take-Two buyout would be by far the largest in EA's history. In January, the company closed its acquisitions of BioWare Corp. and Pandemic Studios, known for their action, adventure and role-playing games, in an $860 million deal.

Announcement Date: February 25, 2008

Deal Value: $2 billion (Cash)

RealNetworks to acquire Trymedia

Digital entertainment services company RealNetworks has acquired Trymedia, a pioneer in Casual Games syndication, from Macrovision. This acquisition is part of Real's strategy to build reach through syndicated distribution partnerships, and follows its acquisition of Game Trust last year and a strategic partnership with Amsterdam-based The Spill Group announced earlier this month. With more than 250 partners including AOL and Yahoo!, Telstra, IGN and T-Online, Trymedia provides innovative syndication and commerce solutions that enable portals, online retailers and game developers to securely distribute PC games through physical and digital channels and maximize revenue throughout a game's lifetime. This acquisition doubles the scale of Reals syndication business.

Announcement Date: February 22, 2008

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Glu to acquire Superscape

Glu Mobile Inc. is acquiring Superscape Group plc, a leading developer and publisher of mobile games. Superscape ranked among the top five mobile games publishers in the United States during Q3 2007a, according to the Mobile Games Report from Nielsen Mobile. Superscape is headquartered in San Clemente, Calif., with a production facility in Moscow and an office in Fleet, Hampshire, UK. The companys strong technical heritage in both development and publishing has led to its success in creating industry-leading 3D games as well as in establishing innovative programs with leading network operators and handset manufacturers. The acquisition of Superscape will considerably expand Glus U.S. presence and add significant development and publishing capabilities to Glus existing world-class resources.

Announcement Date: January 23, 2008

Deal Value: $36 million ($25 million cash, plus $11 million of cash and equivalents currently in the business)

Odyssey Gaming acquires Saturn Software Solutions

Odyssey Gaming Ltd (Australia) acquired Saturn Software Solutions Pty Ltd, a software developer. Saturn Software Solutions has developed a complete range of next-generation platform-independent Management Information Systems and include the Titan cash handling and management systems. With the acquisition, Odyssey Gaming has expanded its range of gaming services products.

Announcement Date: January 17, 2008

Deal Value: $.712 million (Cash and stock)

THQ to acquire Big Huge Games

THQ Inc. is acquiring Big Huge Games, a development studio focused on the Role-Playing-Game genre. Big Huge Games was founded in 2000 by four veteran game developers. The studio is currently in development on a previously announced new RPG title for THQ for the Xbox 360 video game and entertainment system, PLAYSTATION3 computer entertainment system and Windows PC, as well as additional console projects based on their proprietary technology. The acquisition of Big Huge Games is a win for THQ as it continues to expand both internal development capabilities and its portfolio of owned intellectual properties.

Announcement Date: January 14, 2008

Deal Value: Undisclosed

7Seas Technologies buys www.neodelight.com

7Seas Technologies Ltd. (India) acquired the international online gaming company Neodelight. The brand includes the portal www.neodelight.com and was formed by the German company Neokolor GbR. The newly acquired portal www.neodelight.com features 300 games and has more than one million unique visitors and three million page impressions per month. The buyout of Neodelight.com further strengthens the position of 7Seas Technologies with its website www.onlinerealgames.com, which grew 478% in the last three months (Source: Alexa.com). All games are programmed in Adobe Flash technology which means they can be directly embedded in websites and dont require downloading to play the game.

Announcement Date: January 11, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. acquires Illusion Softworks

Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. acquired Illusion Softworks, a premier Central European-based game development studio with operations in Brno and Prague, the Czech Republic. Illusion Softworks has approximately 200 employees and will join Take-Twos 2K Games publishing label as its newest studio, 2K Czech. The acquisition of Illusion Softworks reflects Take-Twos strategic focus on owning high-value intellectual property as it continues to expand its portfolio of triple-A titles.

Announcement Date: January 8, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Handmark to acquire Astraware Game Studio

Handmark is acquiring Astraware (UK), the smartphone gaming studio. Astraware will be the dedicated UK-based game studio for Handmark. The acquisition of Astraware will reinforce the position of Handmark as the leading developer and publisher of high-end smartphone titles. Handmark publishes best-selling smartphone versions of Tetris, Scrabble, and other games, as well as the award-winning Pocket Express mobile news service with millions of subscribers spanning the U.S., Canada and the UK.

Announcement Date: January 7, 2007
